entry.title: [ssci] Uplift openxr third party metadata
entry.content:
This CL adds the Shipped field to each dependency's metadata in the

README.chromium file, not just the last set. It also adds dependency

divider lines, which will mean tools that process README.chromium

metadata will be able to distinguish what metadata is for which

dependency.



Bug: b:285450740

Change-Id: I24d5660f28fae4ed41cfc3c3a0ed2e305d026058

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4848671

Reviewed-by: Piotr Bialecki

Commit-Queue: Anne Redulla

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1193428}

entry.title: [Shortcut] Update shortcut cache before notify observers.
entry.content:
This CL changes the shortcut update logic to update the shortcut

registry cache before notifying the observers. So that if any call in

the observer trying to get the latest shortcut data from shortcut

registry cache, updated data can be returned.



BUG=1412708



Change-Id: Iaa2e77fea4dd56415ec117f82fe592866bf54297

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4845811

Reviewed-by: Tim Sergeant

Commit-Queue: Maggie Cai

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1193427}

entry.title: Reland "[infra] Migrate android-12-x64-rel from Ninja to Siso"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 568d240aa13986ea4986dfec89e7dd2739106137.



Reason for revert: There were Ninja->Siso transitional errors, which caused many local fallbacks. The Siso v0.0.12 includes a fix. https://crrev.com/c/4846867



I confirmed that there are no fallbacks in the android-12-x64-rel try job.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/android-12-x64-rel/513035/overview



Original change's description:

> Revert "[infra] Migrate android-12-x64-rel from Ninja to Siso"

>

> This reverts commit a5fc7ac2a4887af243a2d091c045d74ce32b231e.

>

> Reason for revert: There are unexpected remote failures.

> http://b/299049271

>

> Original change's description:

> > [infra] Migrate android-12-x64-rel from Ninja to Siso

> >

> > This is the first Siso rolluot to production builders.

> > Please check the rollout plan for more details. go/siso-cq-rollout

> >

> > # Rollout criteria

> > `android-12-x64-siso-rel` experimental builder satisfies the criteria as follows.

> >

> > Build speed

> > - P90: +51% speed up (15.37m -> 10.12m)

> > - P50: +25% speed up (9.47m -> 7.52m)

> > (The metrics are taken from http://screen/A45qj93vDzFvaHT)

> >

> > Build failures

> > - No failure rate increase observed (6% -> 4%)

> > - No infra failure rate increase observed (0% -> 0%)

> > (The metrics are taken from http://screen/73FuVU9NS5ULXcC)

> >

> > Test results

> > The build results for the same CQ attempt were identical.

> > https://console.cloud.google.com/bigquery?sq=885976865459:092841f302284c53ae9c4aadefbefd64

> >

> > Bug: b/277863839

> > Change-Id: Ia80019facfd674f341e4d23f66cd65924100d3d0

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4835397

> > Reviewed-by: Takuto Ikuta

entry.title: [PA] Delete deprecated ***WithFlags(...)
entry.content:
- AllocWithFlags and ReallocWithFlags were deprecated in

https://crrev.com/c/4750750 .

- They are kept for compatibility with PDFium, but PDFium switched to

use new functions (AllocInline and ReallocInline).

https://pdfium-review.googlesource.com/c/pdfium/+/111530

https://crrev.com/c/4848003

- Now old functions are not used and can be removed.



Change-Id: I8367790ac2d777a554c52428b927294ae15d157a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4848778

Reviewed-by: Bartek Nowierski

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1193420}

entry.title: [ios] Tighten the conditions for the IPHs for safari switcher.
entry.content:
The new requirement from UX is to only show the IPH when the relevant

UI component is NEVER used, versus used 1-2 times before.



Minor changes to other criteria to make them consistent across the IPHs

for safari switcher.



Add new unit tests and modify the existing cases according to the

config changes.



Bug: 1439920

entry.title: blink/RTCVideoEncoder: Remove WebRtcEncoderAsyncEncode feature flag
entry.content:
This CL removes WebRtcEncoderAsyncEncode feature flag and its related

code because it is launched today.

This CL also removes the if-condition that may drop the frame

unnecessary. So this may reduce the drop frame ratios of the

encoder.

entry.title: [Perf] Update dimensions for win-10_laptop_low_end-perf
entry.content:
The lab is moving devices for win-10_laptop_low_end-perf, while renaming

them and updating OS version at the same time. Making the following

changes to support the move:



* Relax OS and GPU driver versions in dimensions, so new devices

can be matched.

* Add synthetic_product_name in the dimensions.

entry.title: [iOS Bulk Upload] Most of the UI for bulk move passwords to account
entry.content:
This CL introduces a new section in the password settings which only

shows to eligible users. This section allows users to bulk move local

passwords to their account. The CL has some empty protocol methods

which will be implemented in a follow-up CL.



https://drive.google.com/file/d/1L3lYMN1GWJrVHxQpMaJSyjPWPT502MZ1/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-hLAMw0w-QpJlfCRFdYRCKg

entry.title: media/gpu/test/VEAtest: Enable to test VP9 S-mode encoding
entry.content:
This CL adds the test support of VP9 S-mode encoding to

video_encode_accelerator_tests and

video_encode_accelerator_perf_tests.

entry.title: Block intents while the screen is off and add flag for lockscreen intents
entry.content:
Since https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2346652

the DelayedScreenLockIntentHandler has been unused. I think we don't

want to go back to using DelayedScreenLockIntentHandler since it's

hacky, sends background intents from a broadcast handler, and can easily

end up launching Chrome after the user has done something else on their

lock screen and doesn't expect Chrome to launch itself.



I can't imagine any reason we would want to support launching Chrome

with the screen off, so we will no longer process URL intents in that

case. I've continued to allow intents while the lock screen is up just

in case blocking intents there would break buggy lock screens and I

intend to slowly roll out blocking intents while the screen is locked

and monitor for breakage.



If we find that we can't block intents while the lock screen is up I'll

find a better solution than the DelayedScreenLockIntentHandler (I have

some ideas).



Bug: 1477798

Change-Id: Id10a1a3fe0feec98549f06b25d9f8562c8d1a0c4

entry.title: Prerender: Remove kPrerender2IgnoreFailureOnMemoryFootprintQuery
entry.content:
This flag was introduced as a kill-switch of ignoring failure on memory

footprint query in M115. We confirmed this implementation is stable and

the flag is no longer necessary.



More detailed context: Actually this query check is no longer used

regardless of the flag as another flag kPrerender2BypassMemoryLimitCheck

disables the entire code path of the memory limit check including the

query.

entry.title: [color] Update Windows to follow UsingDeviceTheme()
entry.content:
This CL updates Windows to track the state of UsingDeviceTheme()

when deciding whether to express the windows accent and dwm frame

colors in Chrome.



With this CL, if UsingDeviceTheme() is true Chrome will use the

system's accent color as an input into libmonet to generate an

appropriate set of sys color tokens.



Additionally, if use_dwm_frame_color is set on the accent color

observer the accent color will also be applied to the browser frame

directly.



This should not effect the pre-refresh pervasive accent color

behavior on windows. The CL itself should be a no-op as currently

we do not support a toggle for UseDeviceTheme() (this will be added

in a follow up).



Bug: 1469713

Change-Id: I3fd39c8a6a6009c38ed2deb4ff88634391ca0e6f

entry.title: Detach old document before swapping provisional probe sink
entry.content:
In crrev.com/c/4713671 we started using provisional probe sinks for

non-local-root provisional frames, that will be swapped with the

actual probe sink to be used (the previous document's on LocalFrame

swap cases, and the local root's on other cases).



However, on the LocalFrame swap case, if we swap the probe sinks

before unloading the previous document, some resources might stay

around (e.g. css files from the previous document shows up in

*frame-navigate.js tests in https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/linux-rel/1482374/overview).



This CL fixes the bug by making sure that the previous document

has been unloaded before swapping the probe sinks.



Bug: 936696

entry.title: Add ScopedFeatureList to ImageFrameGeneratorTest.
entry.content:
The following 3 tests fail if PartialLowEndModeOnMidRangeDevices

is enabled:

ImageFrameGeneratorTest.frameHasAlpha

ImageFrameGeneratorTest.incompleteDecode

ImageFrameGeneratorTest.incompleteDecodeBecomesComplete



Because the feature makes ImageDecoderWrapper always use the

external allocator to avoid storing duplicate copies of the

data for partial decodes in the ImageDecoder's cache.

(c.f. ImageDecoderWrapper::ShouldDecodeToExternalMemory())



The tests assume that ImageDecoder-s are always cached. So

add ScopedFeatureList and disable the feature while running

the tests.



Bug: 1479089, 1434873

entry.title: Delete any old CLSID registrations in the 32-bit and 64-bit hives
entry.content:
Delete any old CLSID registrations in the 32-bit and 64-bit hives for

service installs, because `installer::InstallServiceWorkItem` does not

do this. This is important for scenarios where the machine may have a

pre-existing 32-bit installation, and the current install is 64-bit. If

any 32-bit keys remain, they will shadow the 64-bit keys.



Fixed: 1479774

entry.title: Float-to-snap should not always results in auto-snapping
entry.content:
When snapping a floated window and another window is available, we snap

that window to the opposite side. But the auto-snap should be triggered

only when the opposite side is empty.

When there is a window on the opposite side, we just want to snap the

pre-floated window and not auto-snap any.

entry.title: [Lacros] Implementing cross-display fullscreen "window placement"
entry.content:
Getting the window management API to work with Lacros.

See https://developer.chrome.com/articles/window-management/ for more info.



This allows applications to place their application windows on a given

display.



Manuel testing can be done with the following test application:



https://michaelwasserman.github.io/window-placement-demo/



As suggested by msw@, I have disabled 5 tests which are remaining to be broken because the current status with the patch is much better as it was before. The tests themselves appear to be failing as XDGPopupWrapperImpl::Repositioned gets called but is unimplemented. I assume that this indicates some async popup callback from Ash changing the order / activation from the popup itself. Pre this change this test was passing incorrectly as the state change was immediately propagated within Lacros without waiting for the feedback from Ash that it has been done.



Bug: 1250088,1034783

Test: Automated tests are coming up, and the disabled tests were not properly working before either. Will get fixed next.

entry.title: Change to non-fatal failure for RunLoop::Run() timed out
entry.content:
This CL changed the failure type of the ScopedRunLoopTimeout GTest error to propagate the ASSERT failures in the test body. It would help LUCI Analysis pick a more describible summary from the ASSERT failure in the test body when RunLoop timeout happens.





Previously, browser tests used a ScopedRunLoopTimeout to automatically fail a test by calling GTEST_FAIL_AT if a timeout occurred in RunLoop::Run(). LUCI Analysis is picking up this error as primary error message for the test failure. However RunLoop::Run() were generally called by test framework and generating similar error message and stack trace, that makes it difficult to cluster the failures.



This CL modified the GTest failure call to be non-fatal. This allows the test ASSERT_* errors to be picked up as the primary error message.



For more detail, see go/gtest-primary-error-message-proposal



Bug: 1365773

Change-Id: I47694396002262af47703cb74512f758407efd93

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4780011

entry.title: [UIA] Introduce the temporary AtomicViewAXTreeManager for Views
entry.content:
Introducing AtomicViewAXTreeManager, an AXTreeManager subclass that

is owned by and created from a ViewAXPlatformNodeDelegate. This is a

**temporary** solution that will allow us to have one AXTree and one

AXNode for each View that needs to be exposed to UIA via an

ITextRangeProvider. This UIA interface allows assistive technologies

to control a specific text range, delimited by a start and end position,

and allow operations like "GetText", "MoveByTextUnit" and much more.



For UIA to be enabled by default in Chromium, we need to make sure the

ATs will work with its Views, especially the Omnibox. We currently

only create a AtomicViewAXTreeManager on Textfields, Labels and

MenuItemViews. This appears to be sufficient for all common use cases

in Microsoft Edge.



The SingleAXTreeManager class is now a test-only class and will be

renamed as such in a subsequent CL.



Bug: 1468416

entry.title: Use child frame hit test region updates for Android selection bounds.
entry.content:
Currently, TouchSelectionControllerClientManagerAndroid is a

HitTestRegionObserver which updates touch selection handle bounds

when an active child frame client receives a hit test region update.

It seems like this is the only time that hit test region updates are

needed, since the client manager stops observing hit test region

updates when switching back to the main frame (and then selection bounds

only need to be updated when compositor frame metadata is sent).



To simplify things and avoid unnecessary observation of hit test region

updates, use notifications from the child frame client rather than

observing aggregated hit test region updates. (This way, we can also

share the aura code path added in CL:4728431.)



Bug: b:286954885

Change-Id: I9520bed400d4f9cf0c76a9366311f0fd9b817fab

entry.title: v4l2: Remove DCHECK in InitializeBackend for state
entry.content:
This is failing now after crrev.com/c/4824609. There can now be 3

different states when this method is called (Uninitialized, Initialized,

and Decoding).



Options are to:

1. Remove the DCHECK

2. Accept all 3 states in that method (why check if we accept that many)

3. Set us back to the Uninitialized state on re-init, which isn't really

logical for the state flow.



So I chose option 1.



BUG=b:299042706

TEST=CQ

entry.title: iwa: Enable Controlled Frame when IWAs are enabled
entry.content:
Controlled Frame previously didn't allow being enabled in any

environment except with a feature flag. However, some environments like

certain kiosk modes on ChromeOS don't support feature flags and so

features that require flags can't be enabled there. After this change,

the existing policy support in IWAs will be enough to enable Controlled

Frame in those environments, too.



This change also removes the kIwaControlledFrame feature flag since it's

now redundant with the IWA feature flag. We may revisit this later if a

need for the flag reappears.



Bug: 1479094, b/297417575

Change-Id: Iae47c8ae7d9664ae02a669812e7a96e487089e4f

entry.title: Revert "Enable by default the `RustyQrCodeGenerator` feature on most platforms."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4b7aea0f323fb3bf14c31d6d1099d6fc637a58bc.



Reason for revert: I guess I was mistaken when I assumed that making the feature enabled by default is a prerequisite for Stable experiments. Finch presubmit are complaining... (see cl/563248796).



Original change's description:

> Enable by default the `RustyQrCodeGenerator` feature on most platforms.

>

> This CL enables the `RustyQrCodeGenerator` feature on all platforms

> except ChromeOS.

>

> Based on the results from the Canary/Dev/Beta experiments (see

> Google-internal go/rusty-qr-experiments for more details if needed) the

> feature team plans to experiment with (and hopefully launch) the feature

> into the Stable release channel within the M117 timeframe (on all

> relevant non-ChromeOS platforms). This CL is one of prerequisite step

> for such Stable experiments.

>

entry.title: Fix nits in PdfOcrService and related tests
entry.content:
This is a follow-up to https://crrev.com/1190258 to do the following

refactoring changes:



- Rename ResetPageCount() to SetPageCount() and update the comments that

explain what it does.

- Change SetPageCount() to also update `pages_per_batch_`, so the caller

can just make one call per page count update.

- Stop initializing `pages_per_batch_` in the header, as the ctor is

doing it instead. Also move this member variable to the correct place

in the header.

- Change ComputeAndSetPagesPerBatch() to ComputePagesPerBatch() to make

its use more flexible.

- Replace std::pair in tests with a struct.

- Mark several getter methods as const.

the \#enable-experimental-web-platform-features flag.

availability URL for each media player. This URL will be used for sink

discovery, which is already implemented for Media Remoting from GMC.

entry.title: graphite: Do not cache GLApi pointer in RasterDecoder
entry.content:
With Graphite, SharedContextState won't make its GLContext current ever

so the thread local CurrentGL pointer can be null. Do not cache this

nullptr in RasterDecoderImpl::api_, and instead retrieve it when needed

like other we do elsewhere (which is not expensive in the first place).

entry.title: [iOS] Search for existing Safety Check module type before inserting.
entry.content:
The Safety Check module may be added to the Magic Stack as one of three

`ContentSuggestionsModuleType` types: `kSafetyCheck`,

`kSafetyCheckMultiRow`, or `kSafetyCheckMultiRowOverflow`. (Which type

depends on the current state of the Safety Check.)

`-indexForMagicStackModule` crashes if clients invoke the method with a

type that doesn't exist in the Magic Stack. To address this, this change

looks directly into the Magic Stack to see if any existing Safety Check

module exists; if so, uses the existing module type for the index.



Change-Id: I52e363f1a9083a7148c8bda81fede87ef9ed3f71

entry.title: Add NotifyClick() to ButtonController
entry.content:
Since responsive toolbar project, toolbar button can be hidden and

overflowed into the overflow menu. We need a way to invoke the pressed

callback of a button programmatically when the overflow menu item is clicked.



Currently there are 2 cases to consider. For most of the

toolbar buttons, the default ButtonController will call into the

PressedCallback in the Button class. For other toolbar buttons (i.e.

ExtensionToolbarButton and AppMenuButton), IconButtonController will

call into its own PressedCallback instead.



This CL adds a method called NotifyClick() to invoke the PressedBack

of the default ButtonController and have IconButtonController to

override it to call into its own PressedCallback, which covers both

cases.



Change-Id: Ic4b387314439c9eed0941713d5df2017f233f3f6

Bug: 1463774

entry.title: [anchor-position] Fix scrolling with auto fallbacks
entry.content:
Existing code uses `OffsetInfo::fallback_index` to check if we are

currently using a position fallback style, in which case scrolling can

trigger a fallback position invalidation.



However, the condition is wrong if the fallback is an auto fallback.

This patch fixes it by adding a `uses_fallback_style` flag to indicate

if the style is a fallback style.



The new flag will also be used by other patches.



Note: even though `anchor(auto)` will be removed soon, the code added

by this patch will still be relevant, because we'll have other forms of

auto fallbacks.



Fixed: 1476972

Change-Id: Ia6be58070a47033158594d5e8e9d9fbf4cf1e794

entry.title: [Perf] Temporary enable dynamic sharding on win-10_laptop_low_end-perf
entry.content:
The lab is moving devices for win-10_laptop_low_end-perf, while renaming

them and updating OS version at the same time. Making the following

changes to support the move:



* Enable dynamic sharding, so the number of shards is dynamically

adjusted as the number of available devices increase and decrease.

This also ensures newly updated devices are tested right away.

* Relax OS and GPU driver versions in dimensions, so new devices

can be matched.

* Add synthetic_product_name in the dimensions.

entry.content:

of NTPs. It holds a reference to {@link TemplateUrlService}, observes

the DSE changes to update the cached values in the SharedPreference,

and provides the new Tab Url of the DSE.

entry.title: Refactor some VR UI files to build for Android
entry.content:
In the process of attempting to re-use some of the browser UI rendering

code for cardboard, some dependencies on specific GL implementations

were found. This change helps to eliminate duplicate GL defines by

splitting the relevant GL portions out of the various files that need

to be shared, and removing some extraneous includes that would otherwise

block building on Android. Most notably, the GridRenderer code is split

out of the Grid class, since it's really only needed by the

UiElementRenderer impl, and the Grid class is used by other UI classes.



Further, VrUiHostImpl had a few direct and transient includes that had

preprocessor errors that they could only be built on Desktop; however,

these classes were no longer actually used in VrUiHostImpl.



Finally, simply extending the `is_win` block for the vr_common revealed

some additional transient dependencies that were needed, at least for

Android.



Bug: 913607,1429376

Change-Id: I8a6d84579d09c32c616d0486b5a9be5b1f1398b5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4846118

Reviewed-by: Brandon Jones

entry.title: Mark dangling pointer when browser exits with open file dialogs
entry.content:
SavePackageFilePicker::download_prefs_ points to

ChromeDownloadManagerDelegate::download_prefs_. The former dangles

when the browser exits because ChromeDownloadManagerDelegate is

destroyed on shutdown but dialogs are not. This CL marks the

pointer as dangling.



Bug: 1479566

entry.title: [css-scroll-snap-2] Add SnapEvent Definition
entry.content:
snapChanged and snapChanging are new JavaScript events defined by

the css-scroll-snap-2 spec[1]. These events are explained here[2] and

will be have more details in the spec[1] when this change[3] is merged

into the working group's repo.



SnapEvent, added by this patch, defines the interface for these new

events.



Bug:1456339



[1]https://drafts.csswg.org/css-scroll-snap-2/#snapchanged-and-snapchanging

[2]https://github.com/argyleink/ScrollSnapExplainers/tree/main/

[3]https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/pull/9056



Change-Id: Ic009ca9706de46128c7b0d68528c60a980067b2a

Commit-Queue: David Awogbemila

entry.title: Introduction of the forced colors provider key
entry.content:
This CL adds a new ColorProviderKey, ForcedColors, to the color

pipeline. This key will allow us to use mixers to handle different

forced colors behaviors based on the forced colors state. This is part

of our goal to move the default forced colors definition to the color

pipeline.



This CL does not change any functionality. In future CLs, we will

implement the mixer for the forced color state, create a forced colors

provider in the WebThemeEngine, and use the provider to paint in

LayoutTheme. This will enable us to eventually deprecate and remove

our dependency on the system_colors stored in the native theme.



Bug: 1430181

Change-Id: I013faaed8ac0db9c55ef649642014a8a3d8d2400

entry.title: [SolidColorLayers] Allow PendingLayers merge as solid color when possible
entry.content:
This is mainly to prevent HitTestOpaqueness (which produce more paint

chunks to contain hit test data) from degrading performance of

SolidColorLayers.



Test: no breakage to existing tests, with or without HitTestOpaqueness

enabled.
